text:
The Surah takes its name from the word dukhan which occurs in verse 10.

Period of Revelation

Its period of revelation also could not be determined from any authentic tradition, but the internal evidence of the subject matter shows that this Surah too was sent down in the same period in which Surah Zukhruf and a few other earlier Surahs had been revealed. However, this Surah was sent down somewhat later. Its historical background is this: When the disbelievers of Makkah became more and more antagonistic in their attitude and conduct, the Holy Prophet prayed: O God, help me with a famine like the famine of Joseph. He thought that when the people would be afflicted with a calamity, they would remember God, their hearts would soften and they would accept the admonition. Allah granted his prayer, and the whole land was overtaken by such a terrible famine that the people were sorely distressed. At last, some of the Quraish chiefs among whom Hadrat Abdullah bin Masud has particularly mentioned the name of Abu Sufyan came to the Holy Prophet and requested him to pray to Allah
to deliver his people from the calamity. On this occasion Allah sent down this Surah.

Subject Matter and Topics

The introduction to the address revealed on this occasion for the admonition and warning of the people of Makkah contained some important points, which are as follows:



"You, O People of Makkah, are wrong in thinking that the Quran is being composed by Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace). This Book by itself bears the clear testimony that it is not the composition of a man but of Allah, Lord of the worlds."


"You are making a wrong estimate of the worth of this Book. You think it is a calamity that has descended on you, whereas the Hour when Allah, out of sheer mercy, decided to send His Messenger and His Book to you was highly blessed."


"You are foolishly involved in the misunderstanding that you will fight this Messenger and this Book and will win, whereas the fact is that the Messenger has been raised and the Book sent down in that particular Hour when Allah decides the destinies, and Allah's decisions are not so weak that they may be changed to a person's liking, nor are they based on ignorance and folly that there may be the likelihood of a mistake or error or weakness in them. They are rather the firm and unalterable decisions of the Ruler of the Universe, Who is All Hearing, All Knowing and All Wise. Therefore, they cannot be treated lightly.


"You yourselves acknowledge that Allah alone is the Master and Lord of the earth and heavens and of everything in the Universe and also admit that life and death are only in His power, yet you insist on making others your deities, for which the only argument you offer is that that had been the practice since the time of your forefathers, whereas if a person has the conviction that Allah alone is the Master, Sustainer and Giver of life and death, he can never entertain the doubt that there can be other gods also beside Him, who can be worthy of worship. If your forefathers had committed this folly, there is no reason why you also should continue committing it blindly. As a matter of fact, their Lord too was only One God, Who is your Lord, and they also should have worshiped only Him, Whom you should worship."


"The only demand of Allah's Providence and Mercifulness is not this that He should feed you, but also this that He should arrange guidance for you. For this very guidance He has sent His Messenger and His Book."


After this introduction, the question of the famine that was raging in Makkah has been discussed. As already mentioned, this famine had occurred on the Holy Prophet's prayer, and he had prayed for it so that when the calamity befell it would break the stubbornness of the disbelievers and then they would listen to the rebuke. It looked as if this expectation was being fulfilled to some extent, for some of the most stubborn enemies of the Truth, on account of the severities of the famine, had cried out: "O Lord, avert this torment from us and we will believe." At this, on the one hand, the Holy Prophet has been foretold :"These people will not learn any lesson from such calamities. When they have turned away from the Messenger, whose life, character, works and speech clearly show that he is Allah's true Messenger, how will a mere famine help remove their disbelief?" On the other, the unbelievers have been addressed, so as to say : "You lie when you say that you will believe as
soon as the torment is removed from you. We shall just remove it to see how sincere you are in your promise. There is a graver disaster about to fall upon you. You need a much more crushing blow :minor misfortunes cannot set you right."

In this very connection, a reference has been made a little below to Pharaoh and his people, implying that those people also had met with precisely the same trial as the chiefs of the disbelieving Quraish are now afflicted. To them also a similar noble and honorable Messenger had come; they also had seen those express pointers and signs which clearly showed that he had been appointed by Allah; they also had gone on witnessing one sign after the other but they did not give up their stubbornness, till at last they made up their mind to put an end to the Messenger's life, and they met their doom, which has since become an object lesson for the people for ever.

After this the theme of the Hereafter has been taken up, which the disbelievers of Makkah vehemently denied. They said: "We have never seen anyone rising back to life after death. Raise our forefathers back to life if you are true in your claim about the life hereafter." In response to this, two arguments for the Hereafter have been presented briefly (1) That the denial of this creed has always proved destructive for the morals; and (2) that the universe is not a plaything of a thoughtless deity, but it is a wise system and no work of wisdom is ever vain or useless. Then the disbelievers demand to bring their forefathers back to life has been answered, thus : "This cannot be done every day to meet the demand of the individuals, but Allah has appointed a time when He will resurrect all mankind simultaneously and will subject them to accountability in His Court. If one has to protect oneself there, one should think about it here. For no one will be able to save himself there by
his own power, nor by the power of any one else."

In connection with this Court of Allah, mention has been made of the fate of those who will be declared as culprits and of the rewards of those who will be declared as successful. The discourse has been concluded with this warning: "This Quran has been revealed in simple language in your own tongue so that you may understand it; yet if you do not understand it and insist on seeing your evil end, you may wait; Our Prophet too is waiting. Whatever is to happen, will happen at its own appointed time."
description: The surah that mentions a divine portent of an evil destiny that will come in the appearance of something unknown called the Smoke. It manifests in the sky and enveils the unbelievers on the earth, until they cry in vain to God that they shall believe in the Quran and its Messenger of only He delivers them from this torment. It takes its name from the “smoke” (dukhān) mentioned in verse 10. The surah highlights the mercy that is the Quran, addresses the obduracy of the powerful and wealthy oppressors, and draws comparisons between the people of Pharaoh, Tubbaʾ, and the Meccans. The people of Paradise will enjoy heavenly bliss while those who were mighty in this world will suer the torments of Hell.The surah is also known as: Mist.

Efendi Nahi.verse 44:3: Na, me të vërtetë, e kemi shpallur (Kur’anin) në natë të shenjtë, dhe Ne, me të vërtetë, jemi paralajmërues.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:4: Në atë (natë) zgjidhet çdo punë e gjykueshme (e paluhatshme),
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:5: me urdhërin Tonë! Na, me të vërtetë, kemi dërguar pejgamberë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:6: mëshirë prej Zotit tënd, - me të vërtetë, Ai i dëgjon të gjitha dhe i di të gjitha,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:7: Zotit të qiejve dhe të Tokës dhe çka gjendet në mes tyre, nëse besoni me këmbëngulje.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:8: S’ka zot tjetër pos Atij. Jeta dhe vdekja janë vepër e Tij. Ai është Zoti juaj dhe Zoti i të parëve tuaj të lashtë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:10: andaj ti prite atë (ditë), kur nga qielli do të lëshohet tym i qartë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:11: që do t’i mbulojë njerëzit, (e u thuhet atyre): “Ky është dënimi i dhembshëm!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:12: (mohuesit) atëherë, do të thonë: “O Zoti ynë, lirona prej dënimit, na, me siguri do të besojmë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:13: E, prej nga ata do të marrin këshilla, e madje u pat ardhur atyre Pejgamberi (me argumente) të qarta?
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:14: E u shmangën prej tij dhe thanë: “(Ai është) i mësuar (prej tjetërkujt) – i çmendur (prej xhindëve)”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:15: Na, do t’i lirojmë ata nga dënimi pak (kohë), por ju, me siguri, do të ktheheni (në mohim)”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:16: (Kujtoju) ditën kur do t’i kapim ata, me një fuqi të madhe – Na, me të vërtetë, do t’i dënojmë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:17: Me të vërtetë, Na qysh më parë e kemi vënë në sprovë popullin e Faraonit, e atyre u pat ardhur pejgamberi fisnik.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:18: (Duke u thënë): “Plotësoni ndaj meje atë që jeni të obliguar, o robërit e Perëndisë, sepse, unë jam për ju pejgamber i besuar;
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:19: dhe mos u madhëroni (mos u ngritni) mbi Perëndinë; unë, me të vërtetë, po ju sjell (prej Tij) dokument të qartë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:20: dhe unë mbështetem në Zotin tim dhe Zotin tuaj (për të më mbrojtur), që të mos më mbytni me gurë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:21: e, nëse nuk më besoni, atëherë (bile) largohuni prej meje!
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:22: (Nuk dëgjuan ata) dhe ai e thirri Zotin e tij: “Me të vërtetë, ky është popull mëkatarë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:23: (Perëndia, atij i tha): “Ec me robërit e Mi natën, meqë do t’ju ndjekin,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:24: dhe lëre ti detin e hapur, se ata, me të vërtetë, do të janë ushtri e fundosur”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:25: E, sa e sa kopshtije e burime i lanë ata,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:26: ara të mbjella dhe pallate të mrekullueshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:28: (ajo ka qenë) kështu, dhe Ne u kemi dhënë trashëgim ato (dhuntitë e tyre) popullit tjetër –
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:29: Nuk i vajtoi ata as qielli as Toka, nuk u lanë ata (për t’u dënuar në një kohë tjetër),
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:30: e Na, me të vërtetë, i shpëtuam bijtë e Israelit nga dënimi poshtërues,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:31: prej Faraonit, - ai ishte mendjemadh, njeri që për keq kalonte çdo kufi –
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:32: dhe, në të vërtetë, i kemi zgjedhur ata, duke i ditur (rrethanat e tyre) mbi popujt tjerë (të asaj kohe),
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:33: dhe u kemi dhënë argumente, në të cilat ka sprova të qarta.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:34: E, këta (Kurejshit), në të vërtetë, thonin:
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:35: “Ekziston vetëm vdekja jonë e parë, na nuk do të ringjallemi (më);
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:36: na i sjellni pra (ringjallna) të parët tanë, nëse e thoni të vërtetën!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:37: A janë këta më të mirë apo populli i Tubbas, apo ata para tyre (Tubbas)? – Ata, Na i kemi shkatërruar, meqë, me të vërtetë, ishin popull mëkatarë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:38: Na, nuk i kemi krijuar qiejt dhe Tokën, as atë që gjendet në mes tyre, për t’u zbavitur (pa qëllim),
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:39: Na i kemi krijur ato me qëllim të plotë, por shumica e tyre nuk e dinë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:40: Me të vërtetë, Dita e dallimit (të së mirës nga e keqja), është e caktuar për të gjithë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:41: Dita kur i afërmi nuk mund t’i ndihmojë asgjë të afërmit, as që atyre do t’u ndihmojë kush,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:42: pos ata që i ka mëshiruar Perëndia, sepse Ai, në të vërtetë, është i Plotëfuqishëm dhe Mëshirues.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:43: Me të vërtetë, druri i Zekkumit (një lloj druri tepër i idhët)
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:44: do të jetë ushqim i mëkatarit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:45: në barkun e tyre vëlon sikur xehja e shkrirë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:46: ashtu si vëlon uji i nxehtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:47: (engjëjve u thuhet): “Rrëmbejeni atë dhe shpieni në mes të xhehennemit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:48: e, pastaj, për dënim, hedhni mbi kokën e tyre ujë të vluar!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:49: (I thuhet atij): “Shijoje, (dënimin), meqë ti je, “i fuqishëm” dhe “fisnik” (me hamendjen tënde),
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:50: kjo është, me të vërtetë, ajo në të cilën keni dyshuar ju!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:51: E, ata që i druajnë Perëndisë, me të vërtetë, do të jenë në vend të sigurt,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:53: të veshur me petka (rroba) mëndafshi të hollë dhe të trashë, duke ndejtur të ulur njëri karshi tjetrit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:54: Kështu (do të jenë të shpërblyer), dhe Ne do t’i martojmë ata me hyri, sy bukur.
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:55: Aty do të kërkojnë çfarë pemësh dëshirojnë, e do të kënaqen (duke qenë të sigurt);
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:56: në to (xhennete), nuk do ta shijojnë vdekjen, pos vdekjes së parë (në këtë botë) dhe i ruan (Perëndia) prej dënimit të xhehennemit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:57: kjo do të jetë dhutni prej Zotit tënd. Ky, me të vërtetë, do të jetë sukses i madh!
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:58: Na, i kemi bërë të lehtë atë (Kur’anin për ta kuptuar) në gjuhën tënde, për t’u këshilluar ata,
Efendi Nahi.verse 44:59: andaj prit ti (të shohësh çka do të bëhet me ta), por edhe ata presin (çka do të bëhet me ty)!

null.verse 44:11: (Elə bir duman ki) insanları saracaqdır. Bu, şiddətli bir əzabdır! (Doğrudan da, Qüreyş müşriklərinə küfrləri üzündən belə bir aclıq üz vermiş, onlar çarəsizlikdən napak şeyləri belə yeməyə məcbur olmuşlar).

null.verse 44:13: Onlara hara, öyüd-nəsihət eşitmək hara?! Halbuki onlara açıq-aşkar bir peyğəmbər gəldi,
null.verse 44:14: Onlar isə ondan üz çevirib belə dedilər: "(Bu başqası tərəfindən) öyrədilmiş bir divanədir! (?zü heç bir şey bilmir, Qur'anı kimsə ona öyrədir)".
null.verse 44:15: Biz sizi bu əzabdan azacıq qurtaracağıq, siz isə (yenidən küfrə) qayıdacaqsınız!
null.verse 44:16: Onları lap möhkəm yaxalayacağımız gün (qiyamət, yaxud Bədr vuruşu günü), şübhəsiz ki, Biz (onlardan) intiqam alacağıq!

null.verse 44:18: (O demişdi: ) "Allahın bəndələrini (İsrail oğullarını) mənə verin. Həqiqətən, mən sizin üçün mö'təbər (güvəniləsi, sözündə düz, əmanətə xəyanət etməyən) bir peyğəmbərəm!
null.verse 44:19: Allaha qarşı təkəbbür göstərməyin. Həqiqətən, mən sizə (dediklərimin düzgünlüyünü sübut edən) açıq-aşkar bir dəlil gətirmişəm!"
null.verse 44:20: (Onlar Musanı daşqalaq edəcəkləri ilə hədələdilər. Musa dedi: ) "Mən sizin məni daşqalaq etmənizdən mənim də Rəbbim, sizin də Rəbbiniz olan Allaha pənah aparıram!
null.verse 44:21: Əgər mənə iman gətirməyəcəksinizsə, məndən uzaq olun!"
null.verse 44:22: Sonra (Musa) Rəbbinə belə dua etdi: "Həqiqətən, bunlar günahkar bir qövmdür! (Pərvərdigara! Bunlara layiq olduqları cəzanı ver!)"
null.verse 44:23: (Allah buyurdu: ) "Bəndələrimi (İsrail oğullarını) götürüb gecə ikən onlarla yola çıx. Siz (Fir'on və onun qövmü tərəfindən) tə'qib olunacaqsınız!

null.verse 44:29: Onlardan ötrü nə göy, nə də yer ağladı. Onlara (tövbə etməyə) imkan da verilmədi! (Əksinə, elə bu dünyada cəzalarına çatdılar; axirət əzabı isə daha şiddətli olacaqdır. Budur küfrün nəticəsi!)

null.verse 44:47: (Allah əzab mələklərinə buyurar: ) "Onu tutub Cəhənnəmin tən ortasına sürüyün!
null.verse 44:48: Sonra başına əzab olaraq qaynar su tökün!
null.verse 44:49: (Və ona belə deyin: ) "(Bu əzabı) bir dad görək! Sən ki (öz aləmində) çox qüvvətli, möhtərəm bir şəxs idin!"
null.verse 44:50: Bu, (dünyada ikən) şəkk etdiyiniz (əzabdır)!
null.verse 44:51: Müttəqilər isə qorxusuz-xətərsiz bir yerdə -
null.verse 44:53: Taftadan və atlazdan (nazik və qalın ipdən) libaslar geyib qarşı-qarşıya əyləşəcəklər.
null.verse 44:54: (Mö'minlərin Cənnətdəki əhvalı) belədir. Hələ onları iri (ahu) gözlü hurilərlə evləndirəcəyik.
null.verse 44:55: Onlar orada (cənnət ne'mətlərinin tükənməzliyinə) arxayın olaraq hər meyvədən istəyəcəklər.
null.verse 44:56: Onlar orada ilk (dünyadakı) ölümdən başqa heç bir ölüm dadmayacaqlar! (Allah) onları cəhənnəm əzabından qorumuşdur -
null.verse 44:57: Sənin Rəbbindən bir lütf olaraq (ya Peyğəmbər!) Bu, böyük qurtuluşdur (uğurdur)!
null.verse 44:58: Biz onu (Qur'anı ümmətin üçün) ancaq sənin dilinlə asanlaşdırdıq. Bəlkə, anlayıb öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edələr!
null.verse 44:59: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Sən (müşriklərin ölümünü, məğlubiyyətini) gözlə. Şübhəsiz ki, onlar da (sənin ölümünü, məğlubiyyətini) gözləyirlər!

null.verse 44:3: Mi smo počeli da je u Blagoslovljenoj noći objavljujemo - i Mi, doista, opominjemo -
null.verse 44:4: u kojoj se svaki mudri posao riješi
null.verse 44:5: po zapovijedi Našoj! Mi smo, zaista, slali poslanike
null.verse 44:6: kao milost Gospodara tvoga - On, uistinu, sve čuje i sve zna,
null.verse 44:7: Gospodara nebesa i Zemlje i onoga što je između njih - ako čvrsto vjerujete,
null.verse 44:8: drugog boga osim Njega nema; On život i smrt daje, Gospodara vašeg i Gospodara vaših predaka davnih!
null.verse 44:9: Ali ovi sumnjaju i zabavljaju se,
null.verse 44:10: zato sačekaj dan kad će im se činiti da prema nebu vide vidljiv dim
null.verse 44:11: koji će ljude prekriti. "Ovo je neizdržljiva patnja!
null.verse 44:12: Gospodaru naš, otkloni patnju od nas, mi ćemo, sigurno, vjerovati!"
null.verse 44:13: A kako će oni pouku primiti, a već im je došao istiniti Poslanik
null.verse 44:14: od koga oni glave okreću i govore: "Poučeni - umno poremećeni!"
null.verse 44:15: Mi ćemo patnju malo-pomalo otklanjati i vi ćete se, sigurno, u mnogobožačku vjeru vratiti;
null.verse 44:16: ali onog Dana kada ih svom silom zgrabimo, zbilja ćemo ih kazniti.
null.verse 44:17: Još davno prije njih Mi smo faraonov narod u iskušenje stavili, kada im je bio došao plemeniti poslanik:
null.verse 44:18: Ispunite prema meni ono što ste dužni, o Allahovi robovi, jer ja sam vam poslanik pouzdani,
null.verse 44:19: i ne uzdižite se iznad Allaha, ja vam donosim dokaz očevidni,
null.verse 44:20: i ja se utječem i svome i vašem Gospodaru da me ne kamenujete,
null.verse 44:21: a ako mi ne vjerujete, onda me na miru ostavite!"
null.verse 44:22: I on pozva u pomoć Gospodara svoga: "Ovo je, doista, narod nevjernički!" -
null.verse 44:23: Izvedi noću robove Moje, za vama će potjera poći
null.verse 44:24: i ostavi more nek miruje, oni su vojska koja će, zaista, potopljena biti."
null.verse 44:25: I koliko ostaviše bašča i izvora,
null.verse 44:26: i njiva zasijanih i dvorova divnih,
null.verse 44:27: i zadovoljstava koja su u radosti provodili! -
null.verse 44:28: Tako to bî, i Mi smo to u nasljedstvo drugima ostavili -
null.verse 44:29: ni nebo ih ni Zemlja nisu oplakivali, i nisu pošteđeni bili,
null.verse 44:30: a sinove Israilove smo ponižavajuće patnje spasili
null.verse 44:31: od faraona - on je bio gord, jedan od onih koji su u zlu svaku mjeru prevršili -
null.verse 44:32: i znajući kakvi su, između savremenika smo ih odabrali,
null.verse 44:33: i neka znamenja puna očite blagosti smo im dali
null.verse 44:35: Postoji samo naša prva smrt, mi nećemo biti oživljeni;
null.verse 44:36: pretke naše nam dovedite, ako je istina to što govorite!"
null.verse 44:37: Da li su silniji oni ili narod Tubba’ i oni prije njega? - njih smo uništili jer su nevjernici bili.
null.verse 44:38: Mi nismo stvorili nebesa i Zemlju i ono što je između njih da bismo se igrali.
null.verse 44:39: Mi smi ih stvorili sa ciljem, ali većina ovih ne zna.
null.verse 44:40: Dan sudnji će svima njima rok određeni biti,
null.verse 44:41: Dan kada bližnji neće nimalo od koristi bližnjem biti i kada sami sebi neće moći pomoći,
null.verse 44:42: moći će samo oni kojima se Allah smiluje, jer - On je, uistinu, silan i milostiv.
null.verse 44:45: u trbuhu će kao rastopljena kovina vreti,
null.verse 44:46: kao što voda kada ključa vri.
null.verse 44:47: Ščepajte ga i usred ognja odvucite,
null.verse 44:48: a zatim mu, za kaznu, na glavu ključavu vodu izljevajte!"
null.verse 44:49: Okušaj, ta ti si, uistinu, ’moćni’ i ’poštovani’,
null.verse 44:50: ovo je, zaista, ono u što ste sumnjali!"
null.verse 44:51: A oni koji su se Allaha bojali, oni će na sigurnu mjestu biti,
null.verse 44:53: u dibu i kadifu obučeni i jedni prema drugima.
null.verse 44:54: Eto, tako će biti i Mi ćemo ih hurijama, krupnih očiju, ženiti.
null.verse 44:55: U njima će moći bezbjedno koju hoće vrstu voća tražiti;
null.verse 44:56: u njima, poslije one prve smrti, smrt više neće okusiti i On će ih patnje u ognju sačuvati,
null.verse 44:57: blagodat će to od Gospodara tvoga biti; to će, zaista, biti uspjeh veliki!
null.verse 44:58: A Kur’an smo učinili lahkim, na jeziku tvome, da bi oni pouku primili,
null.verse 44:59: zato čekaj, i oni će čekati!

null.verse 44:3: আমি একে নাযিল করেছি। এক বরকতময় রাতে, নিশ্চয় আমি সতর্ককারী।
null.verse 44:4: এ রাতে প্রত্যেক প্রজ্ঞাপূর্ণ বিষয় স্থিরীকৃত হয়।
null.verse 44:5: আমার পক্ষ থেকে আদেশক্রমে, আমিই প্রেরণকারী।
null.verse 44:6: আপনার পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে রহমতস্বরূপ। তিনি সর্বশ্রোতা, সর্বজ্ঞ।
null.verse 44:7: যদি তোমাদের বিশ্বাস থাকে দেখতে পাবে। তিনি নভোমন্ডল, ভূমন্ডল ও এতদুভয়ের মধ্যেবর্তী সবকিছুর পালনকর্তা।
null.verse 44:8: তিনি ব্যতীত কোন উপাস্য নেই। তিনি জীবন দান করেন ও মৃত্যু দেন। তিনি তোমাদের পালনকর্তা এবং তোমাদের পূর্ববর্তী পিতৃ-পুরুষদেরও পালনকর্তা।
null.verse 44:9: এতদসত্ত্বেও এরা সন্দেহে পতিত হয়ে ক্রীড়া-কৌতুক করছে।
null.verse 44:10: অতএব আপনি সেই দিনের অপেক্ষা করুন, যখন আকাশ ধূয়ায় ছেয়ে যাবে।
null.verse 44:11: যা মানুষকে ঘিরে ফেলবে। এটা যন্ত্রণাদায়ক শাস্তি।
null.verse 44:12: হে আমাদের পালনকর্তা আমাদের উপর থেকে শাস্তি প্রত্যাহার করুন, আমরা বিশ্বাস স্থাপন করছি।
null.verse 44:13: তারা কি করে বুঝবে, অথচ তাদের কাছে এসেছিলেন স্পষ্ট বর্ণনাকারী রসূল।
null.verse 44:14: অতঃপর তারা তাকে পৃষ্ঠপ্রদর্শন করে এবং বলে, সে তো উম্মাদ-শিখানো কথা বলে।
null.verse 44:15: আমি তোমাদের উপর থেকে আযাব কিছুটা প্রত্যাহার করব, কিন্তু তোমরা পুনরায় পুনর্বস্থায় ফিরে যাবে।
null.verse 44:16: যেদিন আমি প্রবলভাবে ধৃত করব, সেদিন পুরোপুরি প্রতিশোধ গ্রহণ করবই।
null.verse 44:17: তাদের পূর্বে আমি ফেরাউনের সম্প্রদায়কে পরীক্ষা করেছি এবং তাদের কাছে আগমন করেছেন একজন সম্মানিত রসূল,
null.verse 44:18: এই মর্মে যে, আল্লাহর বান্দাদেরকে আমার কাছে অর্পণ কর। আমি তোমাদের জন্য প্রেরীত বিশ্বস্ত রসূল।
null.verse 44:19: আর তোমরা আল্লাহর বিরুদ্ধে ঔদ্ধত্য প্রকাশ করো না। আমি তোমাদের কাছে প্রকাশ্য প্রমাণ উপস্থিত করছি।
null.verse 44:20: তোমরা যাতে আমাকে প্রস্তরবর্ষণে হত্যা না কর, তজ্জন্যে আমি আমার পালনকর্তা ও তোমাদের পালনকর্তার শরনাপন্ন হয়েছি।
null.verse 44:21: তোমরা যদি আমার প্রতি বিশ্বাস স্থাপন না কর, তবে আমার কাছ থেকে দূরে থাক।
null.verse 44:22: অতঃপর সে তার পালনকর্তার কাছে দোয়া করল যে, এরা অপরাধী সম্প্রদায়।
null.verse 44:23: তাহলে তুমি আমার বান্দাদেরকে নিয়ে রাত্রিবেলায় বের হয়ে পড়। নিশ্চয় তোমাদের পশ্চাদ্ধবন করা হবে।
null.verse 44:24: এবং সমুদ্রকে অচল থাকতে দাও। নিশ্চয় ওরা নিমজ্জত বাহিনী।
null.verse 44:25: তারা ছেড়ে গিয়েছিল কত উদ্যান ও প্রস্রবন,
null.verse 44:27: কত সুখের উপকরণ, যাতে তারা খোশগল্প করত।
null.verse 44:28: এমনিই হয়েছিল এবং আমি ওগুলোর মালিক করেছিলাম ভিন্ন সম্প্রদায়কে।
null.verse 44:29: তাদের জন্যে ক্রন্দন করেনি আকাশ ও পৃথিবী এবং তারা অবকাশও পায়নি।
null.verse 44:30: আমি বনী-ইসরাঈলকে অপমানজনক শাস্তি থেকে উদ্ধার করছি।
null.verse 44:31: ফেরাউন সে ছিল সীমালংঘনকারীদের মধ্যে শীর্ষস্থানীয়।
null.verse 44:32: আমি জেনেশুনে তাদেরকে বিশ্ববাসীদের উপর শ্রেষ্ঠত্ব দিয়েছিলাম।
null.verse 44:33: এবং আমি তাদেরকে এমন নিদর্শনাবলী দিয়েছিলাম যাতে ছিল স্পষ্ট সাহায্য।
null.verse 44:35: প্রথম মৃত্যুর মাধ্যমেই আমাদের সবকিছুর অবসান হবে এবং আমরা পুনরুত্থিত হব না।
null.verse 44:36: তোমরা যদি সত্যবাদী হও, তবে আমাদের পূর্বপুরুষদেরকে নিয়ে এস।
null.verse 44:37: ওরা শ্রেষ্ঠ, না তুব্বার সম্প্রদায় ও তাদের পূর্ববর্তীরা? আমি ওদেরকে ধ্বংস করে দিয়েছি। ওরা ছিল অপরাধী।
null.verse 44:38: আমি নভোমন্ডল, ভূমন্ডল ও এতদুভয়ের মধ্যবর্তী সবকিছু ক্রীড়াচ্ছলে সৃষ্টি করিনি।
null.verse 44:39: আমি এগুলো যথাযথ উদ্দেশ্যে সৃষ্টি করেছি; কিন্তু তাদের অধিকাংশই বোঝে না।
null.verse 44:40: নিশ্চয় ফয়সালার দিন তাদের সবারই নির্ধারিত সময়।
null.verse 44:41: যেদিন কোন বন্ধুই কোন বন্ধুর উপকারে আসবে না এবং তারা সাহায্যপ্রাপ্তও হবে না।
null.verse 44:42: তবে আল্লাহ যার প্রতি দয়া করেন, তার কথা ভিন্ন। নিশ্চয় তিনি পরাক্রমশালী দয়াময়।
null.verse 44:45: গলিত তাম্রের মত পেটে ফুটতে থাকবে।
null.verse 44:47: একে ধর এবং টেনে নিয়ে যাও জাহান্নামের মধ্যস্থলে,
null.verse 44:48: অতঃপর তার মাথার উপর ফুটন্ত পানির আযাব ঢেলে দাও,
null.verse 44:49: স্বাদ গ্রহণ কর, তুমি তো সম্মানিত, সম্ভ্রান্ত।
null.verse 44:50: এ সম্পর্কে তোমরা সন্দেহে পতিত ছিলে।
null.verse 44:51: নিশ্চয় খোদাভীরুরা নিরাপদ স্থানে থাকবে-
null.verse 44:53: তারা পরিধান করবে চিকন ও পুরু রেশমীবস্ত্র, মুখোমুখি হয়ে বসবে।
null.verse 44:54: এরূপই হবে এবং আমি তাদেরকে আনতলোচনা স্ত্রী দেব।
null.verse 44:55: তারা সেখানে শান্ত মনে বিভিন্ন ফল-মূল আনতে বলবে।
null.verse 44:56: তারা সেখানে মৃত্যু আস্বাদন করবে না, প্রথম মৃত্যু ব্যতীত এবং আপনার পালনকর্তা তাদেরকে জাহান্নামের আযাব থেকে রক্ষা করবেন।
null.verse 44:57: আপনার পালনকর্তার কৃপায় এটাই মহা সাফল্য।
null.verse 44:58: আমি আপনার ভাষায় কোরআনকে সহজ করে দিয়েছি, যাতে তারা স্মরণ রাখে।
null.verse 44:59: অতএব, আপনি অপেক্ষা করুন, তারাও অপেক্ষা করছে।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:3: Низпослахме я Ние в благословена нощ. Ние предупреждаваме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:4: През нея се решава всяко мъдро дело
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:5: по заповед от Нас. Ние пращаме
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:6: милост от твоя Господ. Той е Всечуващия, Всезнаещия -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:7: Господът на небесата и на земята, и на всичко между тях, ако сте убедени.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:8: Няма друг Бог освен Него. Той съживява и Той умъртвява - вашият Господ и Господът на древните ви предци.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:9: Но те в съмнение се забавляват.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:10: Изчакай Деня, в който небето ще донесе явен дим!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:11: Той ще обгърне хората. Това е болезнено мъчение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:12: [Неверниците ще кажат:] Господи наш, премахни от Нас мъчението! Ние вече вярваме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:13: Как ще са се поучили, когато при тях дойде явен Пратеник,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:14: а те се отметнаха от него и рекоха: Той е подучен, луд.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:15: Ние ще отмахнем за малко мъчението, но пак ще се върнете.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:16: В този Ден най-силно ще ги сграбчим. Ние отмъщаваме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:17: Преди тях изпитахме народа на Фараона, когато при тях дойде достоен пратеник:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:18: Предайте на мен рабите на Аллах! Аз съм ваш доверен пратеник.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:19: И не се възгордявайте пред Аллах! Донесох ви явен довод.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:20: И опазил ме моят Господ и вашият Господ, да не ме пребиете с камъни!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:21: А ако не ми вярвате, оставете ме!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:22: И позова той своя Господ: Тези хора са престъпници.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:23: [Аллах каза:] Върви с Моите раби нощем! Вас ще ви преследват.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:24: И остави морето разцепено! Те са войници, които ще бъдат издавени.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:25: Колко градини и извори оставиха те,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:27: и блаженство, на което се наслаждаваха!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:28: И така оставихме това в наследство на друг народ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:29: И не ги оплака нито небето, нито земята. И не им бе дадена отсрочка.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:30: И спасихме синовете на Исраил от унизителното мъчение,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:31: от Фараона. Той бе горделивец от престъпващите.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:32: И ги избрахме - знаейки - да превъзхождат те народите [по тяхно време].
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:33: И им дадохме от знаменията онова, в което имаше явно изпитание.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:35: Смъртта е само веднъж. И не ще бъдем възкресени.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:36: Доведете нашите предци, ако говорите истината!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:37: Те ли са по-добри, или народът на Туббаа и онези преди тях? Погубихме ги, защото бяха престъпници.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:38: И не сътворихме напразно небесата и земята, и всичко между тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:39: Сътворихме ги само с мъдрост. Ала повечето от тях не знаят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:40: Денят на разделението е срокът за всички тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:41: Денят, в който близък не ще избави близък с нищо. И не ще им се помогне,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:42: освен когото Аллах пощади. Той е Всемогъщия, Милосърдния.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:45: Подобно разтопен метал тя ще кипи в стомасите,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:47: Вземете го и го замъкнете в средата на Ада!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:48: После излейте върху главата му от мъчението на врящата вода:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:50: Това е, в което се съмнявахте.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:51: Богобоязливите ще са на сигурно място -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:53: ще са облечени в коприна и брокат, един срещу друг.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:54: Така! И ще им дадем за съпруги красавици с големи очи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:55: Ще пожелават там всякъкъв плод - в сигурност.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:56: Не ще са вкусили там друга освен първата смърт [в земния им живот]. Ще ги опази Той от мъчението на Ада -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:57: благодат от твоя Господ. Това е великото спасение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 44:58: Сторихме го [Корана] лесен - на твоя език, за да се поучат.

null.verse 44:3: 在一個吉祥的夜間，我確已降示它，我確是警告者。
null.verse 44:4: 在那夜裡，一切睿智的事，都被判定，
null.verse 44:5: 那是按照從我那裡發出的命令的。我確是派遣使者的。
null.verse 44:6: 那是由於從你的主發出的恩惠。他確是全聰的，確是全知的。
null.verse 44:7: 他是天地萬物之主，如果你們是堅信者。
null.verse 44:8: 除他外，絕無應受崇拜的。他能使死者生，能使生者死，他是你們的主，也是你們祖先的主。
null.verse 44:9: 不然，他們是在疑惑中的，是游戲的。
null.verse 44:10: 你應當等待煙霧漫天的日子，
null.verse 44:11: 那煙霧將籠罩世人，他們說：「這是一種痛苦的刑罰。
null.verse 44:12: 我們的主啊！求你為我們解除這種刑罰，我們確是信道的。」
null.verse 44:13: 他們怎能覺悟呢？顯赫的使者，確已來臨他們，
null.verse 44:14: 而他們卻鄙棄他。他們說：「他是受教的，是瘋狂的。」
null.verse 44:15: 我必定要暫時解除這種刑罰，你們必定復返於悖逆。
null.verse 44:16: 我進行最大的襲擊之日，我必定要懲罰他們。
null.verse 44:17: 在他們之前，我確已考驗了法老的百姓。有一個高貴的使者來臨他們，
null.verse 44:18: 說：「你們把真主的僕人們交給我吧！我確是一個忠實的使者，奉命來教化你們的。
null.verse 44:19: 你們不要對真主高傲。我必定要昭示你們一個明証。
null.verse 44:20: 我確已求庇於我的主和你們的主，免遭你們的謀害。
null.verse 44:21: 如果你們不歸信我，那末，你們放任我吧！」
null.verse 44:22: 他就祈禱他的主說：「這等人，確是犯罪的民眾。」
null.verse 44:23: （主說）：「你帶著我的眾僕在夜間出走吧！你們必定要被追趕。
null.verse 44:24: 你讓海水保持平靜，他們必定是被淹死的軍隊。」
null.verse 44:25: 他們曾拋下若干園圃和泉源，
null.verse 44:27: 以及他們所享受的福澤！
null.verse 44:28: 結局是這樣的：我曾使別的民眾繼承他們，
null.verse 44:29: 天地沒有哭他們，他們也沒有獲得緩刑。
null.verse 44:30: 我確已使以色列的後裔擺脫了凌辱的刑罰——
null.verse 44:31: 法老的刑罰。他確是高傲的，確是過份的。
null.verse 44:32: 我確已本真知而選拔他們，使他們超越各民族，
null.verse 44:33: 我賞賜他們許多蹟象，都是有明顯的試驗的。
null.verse 44:35: 「我們只有初次的死亡，我們不會復活。
null.verse 44:36: 你們把我們的祖先召喚回來吧，如果你們是說實話的。」
null.verse 44:37: 他們是更高貴的呢？還是圖白的宗族是更高貴呢？在他們之前的許多民族，我已加以毀滅了；因為他們確是犯罪者。
null.verse 44:38: 我沒有以游戲的態度創造天地萬物，
null.verse 44:39: 我只本真理而創造之，但他們大半不知道。
null.verse 44:40: 甄別日，確是為他們全體預定的日期。
null.verse 44:41: 在那日，朋友對於朋友，毫無裨益，他們也不蒙援助；
null.verse 44:42: 惟真主所憐恤者則不然。他確是萬能的，確是至慈的。
null.verse 44:45: 像油腳樣在他們的腹中沸騰，
null.verse 44:47: （主說）「你們捉住他，然後，把他拖入火獄中，
null.verse 44:48: 然後，再把沸水的刑罰傾注在他的頭上！」
null.verse 44:49: 「你嘗試吧！你確是顯赫的，確是尊貴的！
null.verse 44:50: 這（刑罰）確是你們生前所懷疑的。」
null.verse 44:51: 敬畏者必定要住在安全的地方——
null.verse 44:52: 住在樂園之中，住在泉源之濱，
null.verse 44:53: 穿著綾羅綢緞，相向而坐。
null.verse 44:54: 結局是這樣的：我將以白皙的、美目的女子，做他們的伴侶。
null.verse 44:55: 他們在樂園中，將安全地索取各種水果。
null.verse 44:56: 他們在樂園中，除初次的死亡外不再嘗死的滋味。真主將使他們得免於火獄的刑罰。
null.verse 44:57: 那是由於你的主的恩典，那確是偉大的成功。
null.verse 44:58: 我以你的語言，使《古蘭經》成為易解的，只為希望他們能覺悟。
null.verse 44:59: 你等待吧，他們確是等待著的！

null.verse 44:3: Věru seslali jsme je, abychom byli varovateli, v noci požehnané,
null.verse 44:4: v níž jsou rozdělována všechna zjevení moudrá
null.verse 44:5: podle rozkazu od Nás vycházejícího. A My věru jsme těmi, kdo posly vysílají
null.verse 44:6: jako milosrdenství od Pána tvého, a On slyšící je a vševědoucí,
null.verse 44:7: Pán nebes i země a všeho, co mezi nimi je - jste-li pevně věřící!
null.verse 44:8: Není božstva kromě Něho a On oživuje a usmrcuje a Pánem vaším je i vašich předků dávných.
null.verse 44:9: A přesto nevěřící v pochybnostech si hrají.
null.verse 44:10: Očekávej tedy den, kdy na nebesích se ukáže dým viditelný,
null.verse 44:11: který lidi zahalí; a to bude trest bolestný!
null.verse 44:12: Tehdy vzkřiknou: "Pane náš, odvrať od nás trest tento, my nyní jsme věřící!"
null.verse 44:13: K čemu je jim nyní připomenutí? Vždyť přišel k nim již posel zjevný,
null.verse 44:14: však zády se k němu obrátili a řekli: "Blázen je to, jinými poučený!"
null.verse 44:15: Jestliže jen trochu od vás trest tento odvrátíme, vy zcela jistě se do nevěrectví navrátíte,
null.verse 44:16: však v den, kdy udeříme velkým útokem, pomsty Naší okusíte!
null.verse 44:17: A již před nimi jsme lid Faraónův zkoušce vystavili a přišel k nim posel vznešený,
null.verse 44:18: jenž pravil: "Vydejte mi služebníky Boží! Já pro vás jsem posel spolehlivý!
null.verse 44:19: Nepovstávejte proti Bohu, neb já k vám se zplnomocněním zřetelným přicházím,
null.verse 44:20: a utíkám se k Pánu svému i Pánu vašemu před vaším ukamenováním.
null.verse 44:21: A jestliže mi nevěříte, tedy se ode mne držte stranou!"
null.verse 44:22: Pak volal k Pánu svému: "Tito lidé hříšníci jsou!"
null.verse 44:23: Odejdi za noci se služebníky Mými, neb pronásledovat vás budou,
null.verse 44:24: a přejdi přes moře otevřené; a oni vojska jsou, jež utopením zahynou!"
null.verse 44:25: Kolik opustili zahrad a pramenů,
null.verse 44:27: a příjemností, v nichž vesele si žili!
null.verse 44:28: A stalo se tak a dědici toho jsme lid jiný učinili.
null.verse 44:29: Ani nebesa, ani země nad nimi nezaplakaly a nebyl dán odklad jim,
null.verse 44:30: však dítka Izraele jsme zachránili před trestem zahanbujícím
null.verse 44:31: Faraonóvým; a byl on mezi přestupníky zpupný.
null.verse 44:32: A vyvolili jsme je nad ostatní lidstvo vědomě
null.verse 44:33: a ukázali jsme jim znamení, v nichž zkouška zjevná byla pro ně.
null.verse 44:35: Není jiné smrti než první a my nebudeme vzkříšeni;
null.verse 44:36: přiveďte tedy naše otce, jste-li pravdomluvní!"
null.verse 44:37: Jsou snad oni lepší než lid tubba´ů a než jejich předchůdci, jež za hříšnost jejich jsme zahubili?
null.verse 44:38: A nestvořili jsme nebesa a zemi, a co je mezi nimi, pro kratochvíli,
null.verse 44:39: nýbrž stvořili jsme to jako skutečnost vážnou, však většina z nich to neví.
null.verse 44:40: A věru den rozhodnutí bude časem schůzky pro všechny,
null.verse 44:41: a to bude den, kdy přítel nebude nic platný příteli a nikdo jim nebude nápomocný
null.verse 44:42: kromě těch, nad nimiž Bůh se slituje, vždyť On věru mocný je a slitovný.
null.verse 44:45: Je jak roztavená smůla, jež ve vnitřnostech kypí,
null.verse 44:47: Vezměte ho a do hlubin pekelných jej dovlecte
null.verse 44:48: a potom na jeho hlavu za trest vodu vroucí lijte!"
null.verse 44:49: Ochutnej, vždyť tys mocný, vznešený zajisté!
null.verse 44:50: Tohle je přece to, o čem vy pochybovali jste."
null.verse 44:51: A bohabojní budou věru na místě bezpečném přebývat
null.verse 44:53: a oděni do atlasu a brokátu se jeden na druhého budou dívat.
null.verse 44:54: Tak stane se! A oženíme je s dívkami velkých černých očí,
null.verse 44:55: a budou si tam všechny druhy ovoce žádat, jsouce v bezpečí.
null.verse 44:56: A neokusí tam smrti - kromě smrti první - a ušetří je trest pekelný
null.verse 44:57: z milosti Pána tvého; a to štěstí je nesmírné.
null.verse 44:58: A ulehčili jsme ti to pomocí jazyka tvého - snad se upamatují!
null.verse 44:59: Pozoruj, vždyť také oni zpozorují!

null.verse 44:3: Waarlijk, Wij openbaarden het in een gezegende nacht en Wij zijn de Waarschuwer.
null.verse 44:4: Waarin al het wijze tot in bijzonderheden is uitgelegd.
null.verse 44:5: Door Ons gebod. - Voorzeker, Wij zenden (de profeten)
null.verse 44:6: Als een barmhartigheid van uw Heer; waarlijk, Hij is de Alhorende, de Alwetende.
null.verse 44:7: Van de Heer der hemelen en der aarde en alles wat er tussen is, indien gij er vertrouwen in stelt.
null.verse 44:8: Er is geen God naast Hem. Hij doet leven en sterven, uw Heer en de Heer uwer voorvaderen.
null.verse 44:9: Doch zij vermaken zich door te twijfelen.
null.verse 44:10: Maar wacht op de Dag waarop de hemel een zichtbare damp zal voortbrengen,
null.verse 44:11: Die het volk zal omhullen. Dit zal een pijnlijke straf zijn.
null.verse 44:12: "Onze Heer, neem de marteling van ons weg; waarlijk wij zijn gelovigen," (zullen zij zeggen).
null.verse 44:13: Hoe kan er lering voor hen zijn, terwijl er tot hen een boodschapper is gekomen, die alles duidelijk maakt.
null.verse 44:14: En zij hebben zich van hem afgewend zeggende: "Hij is (door mensen) onderwezen, een bezetene."
null.verse 44:15: Wij zullen de straf voor een wijle wegnemen, maar zij zullen stellig terugvallen.
null.verse 44:16: De de dag, waarop Wij hen met een machtige greep aanvallen, zullen Wij hen zeker straffen.
null.verse 44:17: Wij hebben het volk van Pharao reeds vóór hen beproefd en er kwam een eerwaardige boodschapper tot hen zeggende:
null.verse 44:18: "Geeft mij de dienaren van God, voorwaar, ik ben voor u een betrouwbare Boodschapper.
null.verse 44:19: En verheft u niet tegen God. Zeker, ik kom tot u met duidelijk gezag.
null.verse 44:20: En ik zoek toevlucht tot mijn en uw Heer, vrezende dat gij mij zult stenigen.
null.verse 44:21: En laat mij alleen, indien gij mij niet gelooft."
null.verse 44:22: Toen bad hij tot zijn Heer: "Dit is inderdaad een zondig volk."
null.verse 44:23: God zeide: "Trek met Mijn dienaren ’s nachts weg want gij zult gewis worden achtervolgd.
null.verse 44:24: En doorwaad de zee terwijl deze rustig is. Voorzeker, zij zijn een schare die zal verdrinken."
null.verse 44:25: Hoevele tuinen en bronnen lieten zij achter!
null.verse 44:26: En de korenvelden en de schone plaatsen!
null.verse 44:27: En de aangename dingen, waarvan zij genoten!
null.verse 44:28: Zo was het, maar Wij deden ze een ander volk erven.
null.verse 44:29: De hemel en de aarde weenden niet om hen noch werd hun uitstel gegeven.
null.verse 44:30: En zo redden Wij de kinderen van Israël van een vernederende kwelling.
null.verse 44:31: Door Pharao: want hij was trots en één der buitensporigen.
null.verse 44:32: En Wij verkozen hen doelbewust boven andere volkeren.
null.verse 44:33: En Wij gaven hun tekenen, waar een duidelijke beproeving in lag.
null.verse 44:35: "Het is slechts onze enige dood want wij zullen niet worden opgewekt.
null.verse 44:36: Breng onze voorvaderen dan terug indien gij de waarheid spreekt."
null.verse 44:37: Zijn zij beter of het volk van Tobba of zij die vóór hen zijn geweest? Wij vernietigden hen omdat zij schuldig waren.
null.verse 44:38: En Wij hebben de hemelen en de aarde en alles wat er tussen is niet als spel geschapen.
null.verse 44:39: Wij schiepen ze slechts in waarheid, maar de meesten hunner begrijpeen het niet.
null.verse 44:40: Voorwaar, de Dag der beslissing is voor hen allen de vastgestelde tijd.
null.verse 44:41: De Dag waarop een vriend de vriend niets zal baten noch zullen zij worden geholpen.
null.verse 44:42: Met uitzondering van hen, die God genadig zal zijn. Voorwaar, Hij is de Almachtige, de Genadevolle.
null.verse 44:44: Zal het voedsel voor de zondaar zijn,
null.verse 44:45: Als gesmolten koper zal het in de buik koken,
null.verse 44:46: Gelijk het koken van ziedend water.
null.verse 44:47: "Grijpt hem en sleurt hem in het midden van het laaiend Vuur;
null.verse 44:48: Giet daarna als marteling kokend water op zijn hoofd."
null.verse 44:49: Proef dit! Voorzeker gij waart eens de machtige, de eerwaardige.
null.verse 44:50: Dit is inderdaad datgene waaraan gij twijfeldet.
null.verse 44:51: Voorwaar, de rechtvaardigen zullen in een woning van vrede en veiligheid zijn,
null.verse 44:53: Gekleed in fijne zijde en zwaar goudlaken naar elkander toegekeerd.
null.verse 44:54: Zo zal het zijn. En Wij zullen hen met schone meisjes die grote, mooie ogen hebben, verenigen.
null.verse 44:55: Zij zullen daar naar alle fruitsoorten vragen (en deze ontvangen) in vrede en veiligheid.
null.verse 44:56: Zij zullen daarin geen andere dood smaken na de eerste dood. En Hij heeft hen voor de straf van het laaiend Vuur behoed.
null.verse 44:57: Als een genade van uw Heer. Dit is de grootste zegepraal.
null.verse 44:58: Wij hebben hem (de Koran) gemakkelijk voor uw tong gemaakt, opdat men er lering uit moge trekken.
null.verse 44:59: Wacht daarom, zij wachten ook.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:2: By the Scripture that maketh plain
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:3: Lo! We revealed it on a blessed night - Lo! We are ever warning -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:4: Whereon every wise command is made clear
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:5: As a command from Our presence - Lo! We are ever sending -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:6: A mercy from thy Lord. Lo! He, even He is the Hearer, the Knower,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:7: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye would be sure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:8: There is no God save Him. He quickeneth and giveth death; your Lord and Lord of your forefathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:9: Nay, but they play in doubt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:10: But watch thou (O Muhammad) for the day when the sky will produce visible smoke
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:11: That will envelop the people. This will be a painful torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:12: (Then they will say): Our Lord relieve us of the torment. Lo! we are believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:13: How can there be remembrance for them, when a messenger making plain (the Truth) had already come unto them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:14: And they had turned away from him and said: One taught (by others), a madman ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:15: Lo! We withdraw the torment a little. Lo! ye return (to disbelief).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:16: On the day when We shall seize them with the greater seizure, (then) in truth We shall punish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:17: And verily We tried before them Pharaoh’s folk, when there came unto them a noble messenger,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:18: Saying: Give up to me the slaves of Allah. Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:19: And saying: Be not proud against Allah. Lo! I bring you a clear warrant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:20: And lo! I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord lest ye stone me to death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:21: And if ye put no faith in me, then let me go.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:22: And he cried unto his Lord, (saying): These are guilty folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:23: Then (his Lord commanded): Take away My slaves by night. Lo! ye will be followed,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:24: And leave the sea behind at rest, for lo! they are a drowned host.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:25: How many were the gardens and the watersprings that they left behind,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:26: And the cornlands and the goodly sites
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:27: And pleasant things wherein they took delight!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:28: Even so (it was), and We made it an inheritance for other folk;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:29: And the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:30: And We delivered the Children of Israel from the shameful doom;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:31: (We delivered them) from Pharaoh. Lo! he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:32: And We chose them, purposely, above (all) creatures.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:33: And We gave them portents wherein was a clear trial.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:35: There is naught but our first death, and we shall not be raised again.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:36: Bring back our fathers, if ye speak the truth!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:37: Are they better, or the folk of Tubb’a and those before them ? We destroyed them, for surely they were guilty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:38: And We created not the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, in play.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:39: We created them not save with truth; but most of them know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:40: Assuredly the Day of Decision is the term for all of them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:41: A day when friend can in naught avail friend, nor can they be helped,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:42: Save him on whom Allah hath mercy. Lo! He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:45: Like molten brass, it seetheth in their bellies
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:46: As the seething of boiling water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:47: (And it will be said): Take him and drag him to the midst of hell,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:48: Then pour upon his head the torment of boiling water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:49: (Saying): Taste! Lo! thou wast forsooth the mighty, the noble!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:50: Lo! this is that whereof ye used to doubt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:51: Lo! those who kept their duty will be in a place secured.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:53: Attired in silk and silk embroidery, facing one another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:54: Even so (it will be). And We shall wed them unto fair ones with wide, lovely eyes.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:55: They call therein for every fruit in safety.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:56: They taste not death therein, save the first death. And He hath saved them from the doom of hell,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:57: A bounty from thy Lord. That is the supreme triumph.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:58: And We have made (this Scripture) easy in thy language only that they may heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 44:59: Wait then (O Muhammad). Lo! they (too) are waiting.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:2: By the Book that makes things clear;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:3: We sent it down during a Blessed Night: for We (ever) wish to warn (against Evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:4: In the (Night) is made distinct every affair of wisdom,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:5: By command, from Our Presence. For We (ever) send (revelations),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:6: As Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:7: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them, if ye (but) have an assured faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:8: There is no god but He: It is He Who gives life and gives death,- The Lord and Cherisher to you and your earliest ancestors.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:9: Yet they play about in doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:10: Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind of smoke (or mist) plainly visible,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:11: Enveloping the people: this will be a Penalty Grievous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:12: (They will say:) "Our Lord! remove the Penalty from us, for we do really believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:13: How shall the message be (effectual) for them, seeing that an Apostle explaining things clearly has (already) come to them,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:14: Yet they turn away from him and say: "Tutored (by others), a man possessed!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:15: We shall indeed remove the Penalty for a while, (but) truly ye will revert (to your ways).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:16: One day We shall seize you with a mighty onslaught: We will indeed (then) exact Retribution!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:17: We did, before them, try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them an apostle most honourable,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:18: Saying: "Restore to me the Servants of God: I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:19: "And be not arrogant as against God: for I come to you with authority manifest.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:20: "For me, I have sought safety with my Lord and your Lord, against your injuring me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:21: "If ye believe me not, at least keep yourselves away from me."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:22: (But they were aggressive:) then he cried to his Lord: "These are indeed a people given to sin."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:23: (The reply came:) "March forth with My Servants by night: for ye are sure to be pursued.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:24: "And leave the sea as a furrow (divided): for they are a host (destined) to be drowned."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:25: How many were the gardens and springs they left behind,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:27: And wealth (and conveniences of life), wherein they had taken such delight!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:28: Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those things)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:29: And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they given a respite (again).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:30: We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating Punishment,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:31: Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:32: And We chose them aforetime above the nations, knowingly,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:33: And granted them Signs in which there was a manifest trial
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:34: As to these (Quraish), they say forsooth:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:35: "There is nothing beyond our first death, and we shall not be raised again.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:36: "Then bring (back) our forefathers, if what ye say is true!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:37: What! Are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were before them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:38: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, merely in (idle) sport:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:39: We created them not except for just ends: but most of them do not understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:40: Verily the Day of sorting out is the time appointed for all of them,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:41: The Day when no protector can avail his client in aught, and no help can they receive,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:42: Except such as receive God’s Mercy: for He is Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:44: Will be the food of the Sinful,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:45: Like molten brass; it will boil in their insides.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:46: Like the boiling of scalding water.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:47: (A voice will cry: "Seize ye him and drag him into the midst of the Blazing Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:48: "Then pour over his head the Penalty of Boiling Water,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:49: "Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou mighty, full of honour!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:50: "Truly this is what ye used to doubt!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:51: As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:53: Dressed in fine silk and in rich brocade, they will face each other;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:54: So; and We shall join them to Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:55: There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:56: Nor will they there taste Death, except the first death; and He will preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:57: As a Bounty from thy Lord! that will be the supreme achievement!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:58: Verily, We have made this (Qur’an) easy, in thy tongue, in order that they may give heed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 44:59: So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:3: We have sent it down in a blessed night (We are ever warning)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:5: determined as a bidding from Us, (We are ever sending)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:6: as a mercy from thy Lord (surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:7: Lord of the heavens and earth, and all that between them is if you have faith.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:8: There is no god but He; He gives life and makes to die; your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:9: Nay, but they are in doubt, playing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:10: So be on the watch for a day when heaven shall bring a manifest smoke
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:11: covering the people; this is a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:12: ’O our Lord, remove Thou from us the chastisement; we are believers.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:13: How should they have the Reminder, seeing a clear Messenger already came to them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:14: then they turned away from him and said, ’A man tutored, possessed!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:15: ’Behold, We are removing the chastisement a little; behold, you revert!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:16: Upon the day when We shall assault most mightily, then We shall take Our vengeance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:17: Already before them We tried the people of Pharaoh, and a noble Messenger came unto them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:18: saying, ’Deliver to me God’s servants; I am for you a faithful Messenger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:19: and, ’Rise not up against God; behold, I come to you with a clear authority,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:20: and I take refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you should stone me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:21: ’But if so be that you believe me not, go you apart from me!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:22: And he called to his Lord, saying, ’These are a sinful people.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:23: ’Then set thou forth with My servants in a watch of the night; surely you will be followed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:24: And leave the sea becalmed; they are a drowned host.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:25: They left how many gardens and fountains,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:26: sown fields, and how noble a station,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:27: and what prosperity they had rejoiced in!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:28: Even so; and We bequeathed them upon another people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:29: Neither heaven nor earth wept for them, nor were they respited;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:30: and We delivered the Children of Israel from the humbling chastisement,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:31: from Pharaoh; surely he was a high One, of the prodigals;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:32: and We chose them, out of a knowledge, above all beings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:33: and gave them signs wherein there was a manifest trial.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:35: ’There is nothing but our first death; we shall not be revived.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:36: Bring us our fathers, if you speak truly!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:37: Are they better, or the people of Tubba’ and those before them whom We destroyed? They were surely sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:38: We created not the heavens and earth, and all that between them is, in play;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:39: We created them not save in truth; but most of them know it not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:40: Surely the Day of Decision shall be their appointed time, all together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:41: the day a master shall avail nothing a client, and they shall not be helped,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:42: save him upon whom God has mercy; He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:44: is the food of the guilty,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:45: like molten copper, bubbling in the belly
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:47: ’Take him, and thrust him into the midst of Hell,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:48: then pour over his head the chastisement of boiling water!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:49: ’Taste! Surely thou art the mighty, the noble.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:50: This is that concerning which you were doubting.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:51: Surely the godfearing shall be in a station secure
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:53: robed in silk and brocade, set face to face.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:54: Even so; and We shall espouse them to wide-eyed houris,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:55: therein calling for every fruit, secure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:56: They shall not taste therein of death, save the first death, And He shall guard them against the chastisement of Hell --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:57: a bounty from thy Lord; that is the mighty triumph.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:58: Now We have made it easy by thy tongue, that haply they may remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 44:59: So be on the watch; they too are on the watch.

Muhammad Asad.verse 44:2: CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:3: Behold, from on high have We bestowed it on a blessed night: for, verily, We have always been warning .
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:4: On that [night] was made clear, in wisdom, the distinction between all things [good and evil]
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:5: at a behest from Ourselves: for, verily, We have always been sending [Our messages of guidance]
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:6: in pursuance of thy Sustainer’s grace [unto man]. Verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:7: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them – if you could but grasp it with inner certainty!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:8: There is no deity save Him: He grants life and deals death: He is your Sustainer as well as the Sustainer of your forebears of old.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:9: Nay, but they [who lack inner certainty] are but toying with their doubts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:10: WAIT, THEN, for the Day when the skies shall bring forth a pall of smoke which will make obvious [the approach of the Last Hour],
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:11: enveloping all mankind, [and causing the sinners to exclaim:] "Grievous is this suffering!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:12: O our Sustainer, relieve us of suffering, for, verily, we [now] believe [in Thee]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:13: [But] how shall this remembrance avail them [at the Last Hour], seeing that an apostle had previously come unto them, clearly expounding the truth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:14: whereupon they turned their backs on him and said, "Taught [by others] is he, a madman"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:15: [Still,] behold, We shall postpone this suffering for a little while, although you are bound to revert [to your evil ways: but]
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:16: on the Day when We shall seize [all sinners] with a most mighty onslaught, We shall, verily, inflict Our retribution [on you as well]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:17: AND, INDEED, [long] before their time did We try Pharaoh’s people [in the same way]: for there came unto them a noble apostle, [who said:]
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:18: "Give in unto me, O God’s bondmen! Verily, I am an apostle [sent] unto you, worthy of trust!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:19: "And exalt not yourselves against God: for, verily, I come unto you with a manifest authority [from Him];
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:20: and, behold, it is with my Sustainer – and your Sustainer – that I seek refuge against all your endeavours to revile me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:21: And if you do not believe me, [at least] stand away from me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:22: But then, [when they beset him with their enmity,] he called out to his Sustainer, "These are [indeed] people lost in sin!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:23: And [God said]: "Go thou forth with My servants by night, for you will surely be pursued;
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:24: and leave the sea becalmed [between thee and Pharaoh’s men]: for, verily, they are a host destined to be drowned!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:25: [And so they perished: and] how many gardens did they leave behind, and water-runnels,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:26: and fields of grain, and noble dwellings,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:27: and [all that] life of ease in which they used to delight!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:28: Thus it was. And [then] We made another people heirs [to what they had left],
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:29: and neither sky nor earth shed tears over them, nor were they allowed a respite.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:30: And, indeed, We delivered the children of Israel from the shameful suffering
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:31: [inflicted on them] by Pharaoh, seeing that he was truly outstanding among those who waste their own selves;
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:32: and, indeed, We chose them knowingly above all other people,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:33: and gave them such signs [of Our grace] as would clearly presage a test.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:35: "That [which is ahead of us] is but our first [and only] death, and we shall not be raised to life again.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:36: So then, bring forth our forefathers [as witnesses], if what you claim is true!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:37: Are they, then, better than the people of Tubba’ and those before them, whom We destroyed because they were truly lost in [the same] sin?
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:38: For [thus it is:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in mere idle play:
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:39: none of this have We created without [an inner] truth: but most of them understand it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:40: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] is the term appointed for all of them:
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:41: the Day when no friend shall be of the least avail to his friend, and when none shall be succoured
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:42: save those upon whom God will have bestowed His grace and mercy: for, verily, He alone is almighty, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:43: Verily, [in the life to come] the tree of deadly fruit
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:44: will be the food of the sinful:
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:45: like molten lead will it boil in the belly,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:46: like the boiling of burning despair.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:47: [And the word will be spoken:] "Seize him, [O you forces of hell,] and drag him into the midst of the blazing fire:
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:48: then pour over his head the anguish of burning despair!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:49: Taste it – thou who [on earth] hast considered thyself so mighty, so noble!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:50: This is the very thing which you [deniers of the truth] were wont to call in question!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:51: [As against this –] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves in a state secure,
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:53: wearing [garments] of silk and brocade, facing one another [in love].
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:54: Thus shall it be. And We shall pair them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:55: In that [paradise] they shall [rightfully] claim all the fruits [of their past deeds], resting in security;
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:56: and neither shall they taste death there after having passed through their erstwhile death. Thus will He have preserved them from all suffering through the blazing fire –
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:57: an act of thy Sustainer’s favour: and that, that will be the triumph supreme!
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:58: THUS, THEN, [O Prophet,] have We made this [divine writ] easy to understand, in thine own [human] tongue, so that men might take it to heart.
Muhammad Asad.verse 44:59: So wait thou [for what the future will bring]: behold, they, too, are waiting.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:3: We have sent it down in a blessed night, (because) We had to warn (people).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:4: In that (night), every wise matter is allocated
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:5: through a command from Us. We were to send the Messenger
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:6: as a mercy from your Lord, -Surely, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:7: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of whatever there is between them, if you are to believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:8: There is no god, but He. He gives life and brings death. He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:9: But they, being in doubt, are playing around.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:10: So, wait for a day when the sky will come up with a visible smoke
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:11: that will envelop people. This is a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:12: (Then they will say,) “O our Lord, remove from us the punishment; we will truly believe.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:13: How will they take lesson, while there has already come to them a messenger making things clear?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:14: Then they turned away from him, and said, “(He is) tutored, crazy.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:15: (Well,) We are going to remove the punishment for a while, (but) you will certainly go back (to your original position).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:16: (Then,) the day We will seize (you) with the greatest seizure, We will take vengeance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:17: And We tested the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) prior to them, and a noble messenger came to them
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:18: saying, “Deliver to me the servants of Allah. I am an honest messenger to you,”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:19: and saying, “Do not be haughty against Allah. I bring to you a clear proof.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:20: And I have sought refuge with my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me to death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:21: And if you do not believe in me, then keep away from me.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:22: Then he prayed to his Lord saying, “These are a guilty people.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:23: (So, Allah answered his prayer saying,) “Now, take away my servants at night. You will certainly be chased,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:24: and leave the sea in the state of stillness; they are an army that is sure to be drowned.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:25: How many gardens and fountains have they left behind-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:26: - and how many fields and noble sites,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:27: and how many a luxury they used to rejoice in!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:28: This is how it happened. And We made other people inherit all this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:29: So, neither the sky and earth wept over them, nor were they given a respite.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:30: And We delivered the children of Isrā’īl from the humiliating punishment,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:31: from Fir‘aun. Indeed, he was haughty, one of the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:32: And We chose them, with knowledge, above all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:33: And We gave them the clear signs in which there was a manifest blessing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:35: “There is nothing more than our first death, and we are not going to be resurrected.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:36: So, (O believers,) bring our fathers, if you are true (in your belief in resurrection.)”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:37: Are they better or the people of Tubba‘ and those who were before them? We have destroyed them. They were guilty indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:38: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them just as players.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:39: We did not create them but with true purpose, but most of them do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:40: The Day of Decision is the appointed time for all of them-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:41: the day when no close relation will be of any use to any close relation, nor will they be helped,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:42: except the One on whom Allah has mercy. Of course, He is the All-Mighty, the Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:44: is the food of the sinful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:45: like dregs of oil. It will boil in the bellies
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:46: like the boiling of hot water.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:47: (It will be said to angels,) “Seize him, and drag him into the midst of the Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:48: Then pour on his head some torment of boiling water.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:49: “Have a taste! You are the ‘man of might’, the ‘man of honour’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:50: This is the thing about which you used to be skeptic.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:51: Indeed the God-fearing will be in a place free from fear,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:53: They will be dressed in fine silk and thick silk, facing each other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:54: Thus (it will happen,) and We will marry them with houris having big dark eyes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:55: They will call therein for every fruit peacefully.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:56: They will not taste death therein beyond the first death (they faced in the world). And He (Allah) will save them from the torment of Hell,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:57: as a favour from your Lord. That is the great achievement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:58: So, We had made it (the Qur’ān) easy in your tongue, so that they may take lesson.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 44:59: Now wait. They too are waiting.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:3: Indeed We revealed it on a blessed night. Indeed We have been warning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:4: In it every definitive matter is distinguished.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:5: As an ordinance from Us. Indeed We have been sending from your Lord,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:6: as a mercy. Surely He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:7: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them if you should be certain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:8: There is no god except Him. He gives life and brings death. Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:9: Nay, but they linger in doubt, playing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:10: So watch out for the day when the heaven will produce a visible smoke.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:11: that will envelop the people: ‘This is a painful chastisement!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:12: Our Lord, relieve us from the chastisement; indeed we have believed’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:13: How can there be a reminder for them, when already there has come to them a manifest Messenger,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:14: but they turned away from him and said, ‘He has been taught; [he is] a madman!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:15: ‘Indeed We will remove the chastisement a little. [But] you will indeed revert!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:16: The day when We shall assault with the most mighty assault; [then] indeed We shall take vengeance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:17: And certainly We tried before them the people of Pharaoh, when a messenger came to them, who was honoured,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:18: [saying], ‘Give over to me, servants of God; indeed I am for you a messenger [who is] faithful’,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:19: and, ‘Do not rebel against God. Lo! I bring you a clear warrant’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:20: ‘And truly I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you should stone me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:21: And if you do not believe me, then stay away from me’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:22: So he called to his Lord, saying, ‘These are indeed a guilty lot!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:23: ‘Then set out with My servants by night; for you will assuredly be pursued.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:24: And leave the sea behind at rest: indeed they will be a drowned host’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:25: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:26: as well as sown fields and many a glorious residence,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:27: and the bounty in which they rejoiced!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:28: So [it was] and We made these an inheritance for another people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:29: So neither the heaven nor the earth wept for them; nor were they reprieved.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:30: And verily We delivered the Children of Israel from the humiliating chastisement,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:31: from Pharaoh. Truly he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:32: And verily We chose them with a knowledge over [all] the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:33: And We gave them signs in which there was a manifest trial.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:35: ‘It is nothing more than our first death, and we shall not be resurrected.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:36: Bring us then our fathers, if you are being truthful’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:37: Are they better, or the people of Tubba’ and those before them? We destroyed [them]; indeed they were criminals.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:38: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, [intending] to play.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:39: We did not create them, except with the truth; but most of them do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:40: Assuredly the Day of Decision will be the tryst for all of them,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:41: the day when a friend will not avail a friend anything, nor will they be helped,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:42: except for him on whom God has mercy. He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:44: will be the food of the sinful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:45: Like molten copper it will boil inside the bellies,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:46: as the boiling of boiling water.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:47: ‘Seize him and drag him to the midst of Hell-fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:48: Then pour over his head the torture of boiling water!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:49: ‘Taste! Indeed you are the mighty, the noble one!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:50: This is indeed that which you used to doubt’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:51: Assuredly the God-fearing will be in a secure place,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:53: dressed in fine silk and [heavy] silk brocade, sitting face to face.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:54: So [shall it be]; and We shall pair them with houris of beautiful eyes.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:55: They will call therein every fruit, [remaining] secure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:56: They will not taste death therein, other than the first death. And He will shield them from the chastisement of Hell-fire —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:57: a bounty from your Lord. That is the supreme triumph.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:58: For We have made it easy in your tongue that perhaps they may remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 44:59: So be on the look out. Indeed they [too] are on the look out.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:1: Ha-Mim. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:3: Surely, We have sent it down in a blessed night. Surely, We are the Warner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:4: In this (night) judgment is given on all matters of wisdom (separately),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:5: By Our command; surely, it is We Who send.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:6: (It) is mercy from your Lord. Verily, He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:7: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, provided you have faith with certitude.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:8: There is no God but He. He is the One Who gives life and causes death. He is your Lord and the Lord of your fathers (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:9: Yet they are in doubt, busy playing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:10: So wait for the Day when the sky will cause a clear smoke to appear,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:11: Which will envelop people (i.e., will encompass everything). That will be a painful torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:12: (They will then say:) ‘O our Lord! Remove this torment from us. Surely, we believe.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:13: How can their acceptance of the admonition now be (of any use), whereas there came to them a Messenger with a clear exposition?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:14: But they turned their faces from him and (denigrating) they said: ‘(He) is a tutored madman.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:15: Indeed, We remove the torment a little (but) you will certainly reiterate (the same disbelief).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:16: The Day when We will seize with the Greatest Seizure, (that Day) We shall certainly exact revenge.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:17: And in fact, We put to trial the people of Pharaoh (also) before them and the exalted Messenger (Musa [Moses]) came to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:18: (He said:) ‘Hand over to me the servants of Allah (the Children of Israel). Verily, I am a trusted Messenger for your guidance and leadership.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:19: And do not rebel against Allah. I have come to you with the enlightening proof.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:20: And I have indeed sought the protection of my Lord and your Lord lest you should stone me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:21: And if you do not believe in me, then keep away from me.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:22: Then he prayed to his Lord: ‘Surely, they are a sinful people.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:23: (Allah said:) ‘Then set out with My servants by night. You shall certainly be chased.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:24: And (after you pass through) leave the river still and split open. Surely, they are an army who will be drowned.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:25: How many a garden and spring they left behind!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:26: And green crops and magnificent buildings!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:27: And blessings (and comforts) in which they used to luxuriate!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 44:28: So it happened! We made another people the inheritors of all that.
